snippet: Todd Schneider, the former chef at the governor’s mansion, pleaded no contest to charges that he stole food from the kitchen and was ordered to repay the state $2,300.
abstract: Todd Schneider, former chef at the Virginia governor's mansion, pleads no contest to charges that he stole food from the kitchen and is ordered to repay the state $2,300; tangled case brought to light allegations of misconduct against Gov Bob McDonnell and entangled Atty Gen Kenneth T Cuccinelli II, Republican candidate for governor.
lead_paragraph: Todd Schneider, the former chef at the governor’s mansion, pleaded no contest to charges that he stole food from the kitchen and was ordered to repay the state $2,300.

headline.main: Virginia Governor’s Ex-Chef Enters Plea Deal
headline.print_headline: Virginia: Governor’s Ex-Chef Enters Plea Deal
